text.tspan: PolyOS has always been a Scratch OS, but never has it always been good. Here is the story behind how PolyOS came to be and it's orgins
I started picking up on Scratch again after needing a break from C# Unity, so I started posting on my old account again. I saw an old
project of mine: Web A OS. This was an OS that was somewhat.. meh. I wanted to continue making Scratch OSes so I set out and made
a BIOS for scratch OSes called PIXAPoLY BIOS. Then I got so inspired and I had to make an OS for the new BIOS I made. Then PolyOS
was born. PolyOS = pixaPOLY + Operating System. You get the idea....
At the time, it was no more than a crappy desktop and window system with almost no apps, and of course no functioning ones. As time
went on I didn't really pay that much attention to PolyOS until I kept updation it to PolyOS 4. Then it really started to get popular.
This gave me an urge to keep working on PolyOS as well as Marcus Go's integration with PolyOS. As time came I made PolyOS 5 Skyline.
PolyOS 5 was great but no where near what PolyOS 6 is today. The UI was very rough and had way too many bugs.
Then when my acc got banned, I almost lost all hope. I started shifting back into unity related projects and retiring my Scratch account.
But I saw PolyOS 5 one day and got a spark that made me start a new account, reupload PolyOS 5, and then that paved the way for me
and my team making PolyOS 6. PolyOS 6 is truly the best PolyOS yet. Thank you so much for reading btw. I know it was long XD.
